name: Gulab Jamuns, Vegan (Indian Sweet Balls In Flavored Syrup)
description: Gulab Jamuns Veganized (Indian sweet balls in flavored syrup). Delicious sweet treats made with cardamom and pistachios. Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1/8 teaspoon cardamom powder ((add saffron or rose essence if you like))
a generous pinch of saffron strands
2/3 - 3/4 cup self rising flour (or all purpose flour/Whole wheat flour +2/3 tsp baking powder)
1/4 teaspoon baking powder ((total baking powder, 1/2 to 2/3 teaspoon per cup of dry ingredients))
raisins or raw pistachios to put inside balls ((optional))
1 Tablespoon tasteless oil ((used organic canola oil))
Few Tablespoons water or almond milk

recipeInstructions.text: For the sugar syrup, mix all ingredients in a deep pan( also wide enough to accommodate 10 GJ balls) and bring to a boil. Keep simmering on low till the syrup thickens to a bit thicker than water(3-4 minutes).
recipeInstructions.name: For the sugar syrup, mix all ingredients in a deep pan( also wide enough to accommodate 10 GJ balls) and bring to a boil. Keep simmering on low till the syrup thickens to a bit thicker than water(3-4 minutes).

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, grind the almonds, and then grind the oats into as fine a powder as possible.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, grind the almonds, and then grind the oats into as fine a powder as possible.

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, add the rest of the ingredients for the balls and oil, except water and mix well. Add in a tablespoon of water at a time and make into a soft dough. dont knead too much.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pan, add the rest of the ingredients for the balls and oil, except water and mix well. Add in a tablespoon of water at a time and make into a soft dough. dont knead too much.

recipeInstructions.text: Let dough sit for 5 minutes, covered.
recipeInstructions.name: Let dough sit for 5 minutes, covered.

recipeInstructions.text: Make tiny smooth balls and cover them with damp towel if not immediately frying. Add a raisin or a pistachio in the middle of the ball( that reduces the probability of an uncooked center ;)( cracks in balls are fine, they will not break up on frying!)
recipeInstructions.name: Make tiny smooth balls and cover them with damp towel if not immediately frying. Add a raisin or a pistachio in the middle of the ball( that reduces the probability of an uncooked center ;)( cracks in balls are fine, they will not break up on frying!)

recipeInstructions.text: Fry at medium hot heat in already hot oil. Keep moving them every 30 seconds till the balls are golden brown. (5-7 minutes). The balls will get atleast 3 shades darker in the syrup, so dont let them cook to a deep brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Fry at medium hot heat in already hot oil. Keep moving them every 30 seconds till the balls are golden brown. (5-7 minutes). The balls will get atleast 3 shades darker in the syrup, so dont let them cook to a deep brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove balls and let sit for half a minute to cool slightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove balls and let sit for half a minute to cool slightly.

recipeInstructions.text: Add these balls to simmering sugar syrup.
recipeInstructions.name: Add these balls to simmering sugar syrup.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix them well to coat for 2 minute and Switch off heat(let syrup be on stove to keep warm). Let sit for atleast half an hour. Stir or turn them 2-3 times in between so all balls get good syrup coverage.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix them well to coat for 2 minute and Switch off heat(let syrup be on stove to keep warm). Let sit for atleast half an hour. Stir or turn them 2-3 times in between so all balls get good syrup coverage.

keywords: nut sweets, traditional indian sweet, vegan sweets
